mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-10, upper shelf|upper edge
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lee, Jenny [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: First graffiti references song "Aqueous Transmission," by Incubus. Second graffiti either responds to previous graffiti or is just posing a general question of whether or not people really know what they're doing. Arabic script of word that also appears in Carrel 4-14, plus additional writing. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]
The text within this image may be offensive to some.
Aqueous Transmission | Does anybody actually know what the fuck they're doing?
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Popular music
Life
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: University of Virginia. Library. New Stacks. Charlottesville, Virginia, United States
